Summary._: There is no [A] train service between 168 St and Inwood-207 St in both directions because of a rail condition at 190 St. See mta.info

Description._:
There is no [A] train service between 168 St and Inwood-207 St in both directions because of a rail condition at 190 St.

As an alternative customers may use [1] train service or M4 or M100 bus service making nearby station stops.

LongDescription:
There is no [A] train service between 168 St and Inwood-207 St in both directions because of a rail condition at 190 St. 
As an alternative customers may use [1] train service or M4 or M100 bus service making nearby station stops.

Summary._: Some southbound [F] trains end at Kings Hwy or Church Av because of switch problems at Avenue X.

Description._:
Some southbound [F] trains end at Kings Hwy or Church Av because of switch problems at Avenue X.

As an alternative, customers can use the B68 bus from Church Av making nearby stations stops or the B82 bus for service between Kings Hwy and Coney Island-Stillwell Av.

LongDescription:
Some southbound [F] trains end at Kings Hwy or Church Av because of switch problems at Avenue X.
As an alternative, customers can use the B68 bus from Church Av making nearby stations stops or the B82 bus for service between Kings Hwy and Coney Island-Stillwell Av.

Summary._: [R] trains are running with delays in both directions because of signal problems between 86 St and Bay Ridge-95 St.

Description._: [R] trains are running with delays in both directions because of signal problems between 86 St and Bay Ridge-95 St.

LongDescription: [R] trains are running with delays in both directions because of signal problems between 86 St and Bay Ridge-95 St.

Summary._: TRACK & TRACK PLATE INSTALLATION, REPLACEMENT OF POWER & COMMUNICATION CABLES  [2] [3] Trains run at reduced speed through the Clark St Tunnel between Manhattan and Brooklyn

Description._: TRACK & TRACK PLATE INSTALLATION, REPLACEMENT OF POWER & COMMUNICATION CABLES  [2] [3] Trains run at reduced speed through the Clark St Tunnel between Manhattan and Brooklyn

LongDescription: <b><i>TRACK & TRACK PLATE INSTALLATION, REPLACEMENT OF POWER & COMMUNICATION CABLES</i><br clear=left>[2] [3] Trains run at reduced speed through the Clark St Tunnel between Manhattan and Brooklyn</b>All times, Monday to Friday, until Dec 15  <br><br>The slower speed will keep everyone safe as our crews make critical repairs to the tunnel.<br><br> Please allow additional travel time.<br><b><br>
